newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila's SEC orders firms to use depository unit.
newsitem.headline: Manila's SEC orders firms to use depository unit.

text.p: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) said on Friday it directed the Philippine bourse to require all listed firms to lodge their shares in a central depository house.
In the order, SEC Chairman Perfecto Yasay said the placement of the shares in the Philippine Central Depository Inc (PCD) will help create an efficient and transparent securities market.
The move is expected to help pave the way for scripless equities trading.
"The Commission has noted with grave concern the fact that corporate issuers have refused to lodge listed shares in the PCD," Yasay said. He did not state the reasons for the refusal.
Early this year, the Philippines started scripless trading with a number of companies to speed up stock transfers and minimise opportunities for fraud.
The Philippine Stock Exchange had said it wanted 75 percent of trading volumes scripless by June.
